definition[0]: a way of writing a document on a computer so that its structure is clear, and so that it can easily be read on a different computer system
definition[1]: standard generalized mark-up language; a computer language for creating files, using a system of codes to label the different parts of a file so that those parts can be grouped together or treated in a similar way to each other
example[0]: The SGML data format allows documents to be shared between different publishing systems.
